docs.snippet: Eight South American presidents  on Monday night voiced their strong support for Bolivia's president, Evo Morales, and called on rebel governors in the country's eastern provinces to end violent protests against his socialist policies. Meeting in...
docs.lead_paragraph: Eight South American presidents on Monday night voiced their strong support for Bolivia's president, Evo Morales, and called on rebel governors in the country's eastern provinces to end violent protests against his socialist policies. Meeting in Santiago, Chile, the presidents of Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Paraguay, Uruguay and Venezuela also rejected any break-up of Bolivia's territory and called for an investigation into attacks in Pando Province, where as many as 30 people were killed last week.

headline.main: Small Businesses in a Financial Hurricane
headline.print_headline: Small Businesses in the Path of a Financial Hurricane

byline.original: By PATRICK McGEEHAN and KEN BELSON

docs.snippet: Mr. Villasante, 46, owner of V & V Construction in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn,  immigrated from Uruguay in 1986. He has been in business for 17 years, running a small contracting firm that specializes in painting and home renovations. He typically employs...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Villasante, 46, owner of V & V Construction in Ditmas Park, Brooklyn, immigrated from Uruguay in 1986. He has been in business for 17 years, running a small contracting firm that specializes in painting and home renovations. He typically employs nine workers during the busy months. But with half as many jobs as he had last year, he has been operating with only his four regular workers. It's down. The economy is bad and people don't have the money, though I work in a neighborhood that is middle-class.
docs.abstract: Profile of Ruben Villasante, owner of V & V Construction in Brooklyn, one of six small businesses New York Times is tracking to see how they weather tough economic times; he says business is down because people are putting their money where they need it; photo (S)

headline.main: Region's Small Businesses in Path of a Financial Hurricane

byline.original: By PATRICK McGEEHAN and KEN BELSON
